title: integration - Integral of Legendre's function
body: Is there any formula for computing the following integral $$\int_a^1(P^m_l)^2(x)\,dx \, ,\text{with} -1<a<1$$ where $P^m_l$ is the associated Legendre's function (of the first kind) of order $m\in\mathbb{N}$ and of degree $l=-0.5+it$ with $t\in\mathbb{R}$ . integration special-functions hypergeometric-functions legendre-polynomials Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Aug 12, 2020 at 11:43 asked Aug 11, 2020 at 22:59 rihani 61 2 2 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 3 $\begingroup$ Similar question: mathoverflow.net/q/366081 $\endgroup$ Max Alekseyev –  Max Alekseyev 2020-08-12 02:53:28 +00:00 Commented Aug 12, 2020 at 2:53 $\begingroup$ with that $a$ in there, you are asking for the indefinite integral. $\endgroup$ Gerald Edgar –  Gerald Edgar 2020-08-12 10:42:46 +00:00 Commented Aug 12, 2020 at 10:42 $\begingroup$ the variable $a$ belongs to $(-1;1)$. $\endgroup$ rihani –  rihani 2020-08-12 11:43:55 +00:00 Commented Aug 12, 2020 at 11:43 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
